intro: Hypochaeris laevigata, commonly known as the smooth mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers, which appear in clusters, bloom from spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hypochaeris laevigata is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in some regions.
